W0QvbqrK5CX4eCiAKSTkqg.text: great restaurant, I enjoy coming here for breakfast/lunch occasionally. Would definitely recommend as mentioned in previous comments it is light and airy with excellent service. upstairs is better than downstairs in my opinion. Free wifi available, and it says something about the clientele that I've only ever seen Macs in there! Relatively pricey though hence 4 stars.

2OAeG8cUFr58UMOJ8meWVA.text: We went here just for a quick coffee and a tea and were very pleased. The place is really nice and you can appreciate how they care about details. I ordered an organic herbal infusion of red fruits, that came in a teapot, sufficient for two very generous cups. It was great with the demerara sugar lumps. Even the bathroom is nice! They had Aveda hand soap and moisturising milk, scented with rosemary and mint. I will definitely be going back to try the organic food, that looked delicious.

dNR6EWfXnI0j4cA-z30YuQ.text: We LOVE this place. We held my birthday party party there in June. The restaurant has a beautiful space on the upper floor which the staff closed off for our private event and decorated beautifully with flowers and candles. The food was wonderful, the staff attentive and they made the most wonderful birthday cake (we are speaking to them about doing a wedding cake too!). It would be perfect for a corporate cocktail party or a drinks and canapes wedding reception. I'm not exactly sure how many people they can fit but we had 70 people for my birthday and we were very comfortable. I cannot recommend the place highly enough!

2ivfmsr0e4z1P0H29XGZ8g.text: This was the best breakfast we had on our London/Paris trip.  Food was great and reasonably priced.  Waitress helpful in selecting items.  Food came out quickly.  The dining area upstairs was pleasant and pretty unique.

2p93vkT6Prqc7oJqufn7uw.text: Three types if scones, cashew cheese, and excellent cappuccino with almond milk, fresh pressed green juices - yummm!

zbKPwK9KTdqr3pggM0JMeA.text: I have never seen such an uncoordinated staff in my life. They were all running around withiut really doing anything. Getting seated, getting a menu, paying and most importantly, getting our coffee, took ages! On top of that the prices are unreasonably high. 3 pounds for a croissant? In any other country, people would refuse to pay that much. I'll not be returning here!

vwM_0z2zVLkU1RTQsBhgKw.text: I like coffee.I like bowls. (Honestly, whatever food I'm eating, I'd likely rather be eating it out of a bowl. The sides are just so ideal for scoopage.)Therefore, a coffee served in a bowl the size of my face is heaven... I just have to figure out a way to drink it all before it gets cold. However it's not the bowled-coffee that sets this Le Pain apart, but rather the nice and light upstairs seating area and smokin' fast internet that makes this a perfect meeting point for meetings in the west of London. Tasty breakfasts (I highly recommend the porridge with bananas, berries and nuts), aforementioned bowled coffee/tea and great sandos to go make Le Pain a delightful any-time stop in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom

6g_hoc2EWiDJ4hxvT7uEIQ.text: We stopped here first after getting off the Oxford bus, highly recommended by my friend.  We had about an hour before we had to jump on the underground to make it to Buckingham Palace to see the changing of the guards.  Service was great in getting our food and bill to us in a timely manner.  My croissant with gruyere and tomato was light and flavorful.  It was so good that I made the same thing when I got home!  Needless to say, we got to Buckingham Palace on time but the crowds were so thick that we couldn't see anything. Boo...

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom. Croissant with gruyere and tomato

N1XXeg_7hhoe4z2Rc7opcw.text: Just perfect! I took the farmer brunch and everything on my plate was fantastic and tasteful.

Y1WCUHWgdS77H00R8-d5Lg.text: I love this le pain quotidien location. It has 2 stories with more than enough seating, not to mention floor to ceiling windows that let in plenty of natural light. It is great for people watching and good for doing some light studying or reading. If only they have chairs that are more comfortable ...I like that they offer large bowl cafe au laits, but did not think their Belgian waffle was worth the price.

EyodhdoB0TOkUxhU8dBy1w.text: I love this spot, it cozy and a great space for families with kids. The staff are very nice and the smile always there. The coffee is very good. A wonderful place to start your day 4sure... A Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom

U19KWHZp2Orjqc9qVYnqFA.text: A gem.  My wife and I enjoyed a lovely lunch after visiting the Portobello Road Market.  Excellent food, good service, free wi-fi... and seemingly the only restaurant in London that serves iced tea.

ACiFoLj7fUf8B0OF4KS9XA.text: I just saw a nameof friendreviewing Le Pain Quotidienand I had tovisit in there. AndI found this place completely,only by coincidence. The food here is absolutegood. I like most having my own teapot filled w/ decaf with almond croissantand humus just perfectness really. Seriously, this place is great. They'renot too expensive but even if they were I assure you, totally worth it!

W2EHe0184stoUBKjwRbkxQ.text: Ok, this breaktfast couldnt be an everyday habit. To much for our budget, that should have included to eat in the hostel, and to much for our waist-line. And it is to perfect to eat only little. The name of this restaurant will be a tounge twister for me, for ever and yet i will remember it very positiv. It is remarkably less noise in here, no loud music, the service is much more attentiv and friendly and there are many real windows that let the daylight in. On top of that it is all very tidy, even the toilets are very nice decorated and tidy. All things that, we learned the days before, cant be taken for granted in good old London. My fresh made, warm porridge tasted so good! Ok, i took the wonderful strawberry-marmelade on it, too. The egg with bread was also perfect. The absolute highlight was the fresh and warm scone, served with cream!No comparison to all other scones i was used to. At home i use organic flour and i know that this give this great taste. We took this perfect strawberry-marmelade on the cream on the scone and were floating in the 7. sky of breakfast!

AFEUkx1tBPNP0_bc960JfA.text: The prettiest branch if le pain!I used to be a big fan of Le Pain, not in US though. I found this in London at first and actually they serve little bit differently. Brunch during weekend can be busy, but yeah, worth going and trying their food. I also like their pasties, but I don't have it because there's always something else I want more. I hope they have more dessert like menu, because that's how I become a fan of Le Pain. Oh and I gotta say that I like the interior design too

CDGDjwFQQriSOO7gJnA56w.text: Ok, so this is unlikey to be an unbiased review, Le Pain kept me sane while we were living in New York (there are several in Manhattan), as somewhere I could always find great organic vego food amongst what felt like a field of steak houses. This particular spot is one of the larger Le Pains, which is just as well given that we visited on a rainy, school holiday lunch time on our way to the nearby museums. The service was friendly and efficient, the tomato tart wasn't quite what I was expecting (I was thinking quiche, not tomato on puff pastry) but was tasty and quickly devoured by myself and my toddler.Reasonably kid friendly, you can always fall back on fruit or their excellent bread if your little one is having a particularly picky day, though there is plenty on the menu that should tempt them.Great place to go in the mid morning or afternoon to just sit, drink tea (and scoff rhubarb crumble) and read a book...

87h1wQwZwQQmuLKUCCBa6Q.text: A lovely branch of this French chain. I like Le Pain as it is reasonably priced and the cakes are pretty up there. The open tartine as well; such a lovely idea and all those cold cuts and fishy platters are perfect for the London sunshine! The highlight of my meal this week was the Flute (long very thin baguette style bread) topped with Camembert under the grill with honey! Simple but so rewarding and a plum tart... ohhh the buttery, marzipan biscuit base! Thumbs up!

m3ypjNUvuHrGElUPP8Wd-Q.text: I like Tabasco sauce on my scrambled eggs.  In a pinch, any hot sauce will do.  Is that a crime?  Apparently yes at Pain Quotidien, because the waitress looked at me as if I had just peed on the sidewalk when I politely inquired if she might bring me some.  The cook actually came to my table to ask me if there was something wrong with my eggs.  Why else would I want to dose them in that foul sauce?  Needless to say, there was no hot sauce in the building.This is one of the larger Pain Quotidiens in London, and the best part about it is the large windows and sunny upper floor.  Unlike many of the smaller branches, they serve scrambled eggs with a variety of sides (note: don't get confused by  "scrambled eggs with mushrooms" - it means scrambled eggs with a side of sauteed mushrooms, not eggs and mushrooms scrambled together).   Scrambled eggs are not the trickiest dish in the cookbook, but these were none too great.  They also serve the signature ginormous (yes, that's a word in my dictionary) lattes that come in cereal bowls. Best enjoyed with brown sugar, no hot sauce required.Atmosphere: 4 starsBreakfast: 2 stars  Stick with the sunshine and coffee.

kuiPd6Irhol6F_nWXi95PQ.text: The perfect spot to spend a Sunday morning. I met a friend here for coffee but we got a cake fiesta going. We tried four types of them and they were all heavenly.

SFRK0Q3tzhI83JozfAECKw.text: Delicious and fresh ingredients, and a really calm and relaxing atmosphere. It can get pricy if you get a drink but it's somehow worth it when you can relax and catch up with friends over a couple of hours without being disturbed.

91-UCVuS5InBnJJKFb2NBg.text: I sometimes venture here on my own or to meet friends for lunch. I'm addicted to their scones - warm, soft and with cream and jam is soo good, my mouth is watering just thinking about it :-) Location wise, it's just moments away from Notting Hill Gate Underground Station.

sQkq1oDTfwBbhcLmfIfq3A.text: Have been here a few times and on two occasions have ordered the Belgium waffle.  Yum!!!  Perfect amount of sugar, softness, just perfect!  It's only one waffle and not very large, so don't expect it to fill you up if you're really hungry.  The second floor has a great view, with very large windows that peer out into Notting Hill Gate, perfect for a sunny but too cold to sit outside afternoon.  The large cappuccino and lattes really are large and come served in a bowl.  Also great.  I've tried a couple of there open-face sandwiches and their pumpkin soup, all pretty good.  I do have to say, the service tends to be hit or miss here.  Some waiters/waitresses have been very nice and attentive, others not so much and act as if they have some sort of a chip on their shoulder, but overall, worth checking out, especially if you can sit on the second floor.

ulmRT0R_kwMB51-DbFsFxw.text: Stopped in on my way to Hyde Park.  Was nice to sit in an open-air restaurant with a breeze.  The hostess and server were friendly and attentive.  Didn't have breakfast, so didn't want to fill up on sweets, thought it best to have something to sustain me since I would be trekking through Hyde Park., so decided on a capuccino w/ scrambled eggs & toast.  Came back later to have a hot chocolate and pear tart :)

GhRFMtdwWq0NdjaMOPpDVQ.text: Came to this nice and clean place for my first breakfast in London. The food was good, but not fulfilling. The latte was huge, like a bowl size huge. It's all about organic or natural here!Service could have been better, if my waiter refill my water without me constantly asking.

V5BBw5LJkjjOs4CrhTGbBQ.text: Orange juice: they fill up your glass with ice for 3.95£.When asked they explain it is their recipe... It is a rip off...

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom

gKgsaSSyll8gHFDrXWWhlA.text: Terrible service. Three tables that came and sat after me had their orders taken while I sat nearby, trying to get their attention. They don't seem to care at this location.

t12TXRsLLWAtpEgi7xLByA.text: This restaurant has delicious fresh well-made food and polite efficient wait staff. The day we came we had to wait a bit and it was crowded -they were understaffed some servers are called in sick. The wait staff worked well as a team, was pleasant and the food came Out correct and delicious - errors were corrected quickly. We will definitely return.

kbVrQWVxq1EwtZ8b2i6u6Q.text: After wondering around Notting Hill during the Portobello Market we ended up here for an extremely late breakfast/early lunch. We literally couldn't get in anywhere we tried! Service was not the best but we were so hungry and were happy to order a big huge breakfast. I had one of their fresh squeezed juices and loved it. I'm not usually a fan of chains but sometimes that's just how it works out and in this case it was totally fine.

PbXObD1oGBuj27AZy1SvQg.text: I love Le Pain! I was just a little disappointed they didn't have all day brunch, but what I ordered was very good! Follow the suggestions on their board, you won't be disappointed!

WM7Qb7PL1hJ2s4ZoxVGZMQ.text: The service here is awful! A sign asked for customers to wait to be seated so we did while the staff was oblivious. We then waited about ten minutes for the server to come to the table and she was short and snapped when she did. Our order was messed up three times and the food was average. I love the concept and wouldn't mind paying the price if the service was even decent. Staff was standing around talking while multiple customers were clearly trying to get their attention.  We finally asked for the check and when the waiter asked if everything was okay we said it was decent but she didn't ask what could've been better. Service was probably terrible because tip is included. Shame.

N17bv_OQ4Uo1nZsQEsc3Lw.text: I remember discovering my first Le Pain Quotidien in Marylebone and how excited I was to be served open rye bread sandwiches on ceramic boards - just like my grandma used to do!  LPQ worked well in a cosy street corner location in a neighbourhood that provided the perfect backdrop for a bit of continental food nostalgiaFast forward a few years and Pain has joined the ever growing number of cafe chains dominating the scene.  And while the food is still good and the French coffee bowls on rustic tables still attractive, the concept loses its appeal when repeated to often and when squashed into a square shape that used to be a building society on West London's ugliest high street.As it's just up from the tube station, it's too convenient to ignore and does a good trade.

WhecyUpc55RXEwyPf3CqbQ.text: LPQ is my favourite coffee chain out of Pret, Eat etc. Coffee and food are always consistent across all branches, however the service at this Notting Hill one was a bit off compared to others... Seemed to be unnecessarily frazzled considering it wasn't very busy, and lacked a bit of common sense. Took a while to get attention for the bill and also to pay. Shame really.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom

aELY7oMEviBfUNlDC6MNyA.text: DO NOT GO HERE Food and service combined for one of the worst meals I have had in Europe. Staff was oblivious, messed up 3 things in my order, rude, and when the food finally came it was BAD. This place has potential if everyone was retrained, front and back of the house. Really really really terrible. This place actually inspired me to make a yelp account to wright this review. At least now I can give good reviews to places that deserve it. Just one more time for the road.....TERRIBLE Maybe they're take away service for coffee js passable. -_-

8iVe_Gd03nqpjxvZahYk9g.text: The 2nd floor and seating is pretty amazing. Definitely a fan and will be back - great place to study. Service could have been a bit better and food is bit more on the pricey side. But overall 4/5!

OzvvBEM2NYi8CQCSMrt8CQ.text: Great atmosphere, friendly staff, nice breakfast choices and high qualityClear recommendation.

unrCFMoplV0wKcRWAuY81A.text: I have been dining in just this Le pain twice and don't have any blaming: food is good, the place is cleaned and I like their fresh juice, teas and coffees.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom. Chicken & leek pie

fOz8dwXk-QIKZaRCKIr8Bg.text: Best cofee we had in london.The food is very good, and the portions are large and satisfying.Defenitley worth a visit

QGk-ywL3qnqlC8wEU4wuPA.text: I took my family to this place along with my cousin visiting from the United States.  We were hoping to enjoy a nice meal in a nice place.  We enjoyed the area performances, magic shows shops, etc.  When we got really tired and ready for food we decided to go to this place.  The place is really too tight.  Do not expect much elbow room if you go there with more than two people. This place is simply awful!  Service was simply substandard.  The waiter was absolutely rude, short with any of us who placed orders at our table and very offensive.  One of the guests didn't like the ice tea he got, and he wanted it changed with another drink after the first couple of sips.  The waiter got visibly irritated and angry throwing silver wear on our table and even aggressive and rude words.  I had ordered ice tea by chance also.  When I took a sip of the drink I almost threw up. It was the worst ice tea I had ever tasted.  Another waiter came by after that and she was also super rude, and short all during our dinner.  I asked the drink to be changed with water and I got lectured by the second waiter.  The first waiter even acted like he wanted to get physical with one of our family members.  Needless to say the experience was horrible.  We decided to leave right as we saw the behavior develop, but we had an elderly person with us who had to eat right away due to medical reasons. So we stayed and endured the rude treatment of our group and the way another couple were treated in this over priced restaurant.  Stay away from this place as you will be paying a lot of money for a very average food, and get treated horribly by a very rude group of employees.

wV9Z8u9ZylGNcHKVnPj11A.text: One of my preferred LPQ in London. I've tried three so far. I have to admit, they don't measure up to our L.A. or NYC ones. I don't know...the food is just different (definitely more bland and a little meh). But, the general menu is the same and I like the vegan options. If in London, I'd recommend the Notting Hill Gate location over others.

uouML6WeVB3-pXohQ-_Clg.text: I've been here twice. The first time was back in August and I got the Porridge with bananas and honey. Due to a dairy allergy, the chef made it with soya instead of milk. It honestly had me dreaming of it for months. I came back to London this week for a trip with my sister. I had the same thing again! It was just as delicious and filling. It's the perfect way to start your day. My sister got the Belgium waffle with the chocolate sauce on the side. She said it was one of the best waffles she's ever had in her life. It was like a dense donut that was rich and savory. It was small and she was nervous is wouldn't be enough but it was the perfect size. I got an Americano and she got a lemonade which was tart but deliciously homemade. Highly recommend for a night brunch before a flight out!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom. Americano, soya porridge with bananas and honey.
Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom. Belgium waffle with chocolate sauce on the side!
Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom. Americano, porridge made with soya and topped with bananas and honey.

OUYxULzBwIyFpqDEyslFbg.text: I get my morning caffeine fix here.. With a side of fruity bread thingy! I've been buying the stuff for years and I still don't know the bloody name of it ... The staff seem to always know what I'm talking about so hey ... Lol A nice spot for coffee and breakfast! It's clean and the French waiter there is perfect eye candy for the Monday blues

LcQZfkxCD7gaG9mK4L_6oA.text: Almost first customer i came at 08:03 am. The place is nice , clean and good sized. I had scramble eggs with salmon, classic but nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pain Quotidien - London, United Kingdom. Scramble egg with salmon.

BH0dub225KIe8ZD46u8Riw.text: This is one of my favorite Le Pain locations. Clearly, other Yelpers agree. It is two-stories with plenty of different sized tables to suit your needs. Wifi is available for free.The coffee is served extra large. Ordered a medium cappuccino, I received a jumbo bowl. I couldn't finish it all before it got cold. Take-away options are exactly the same as the main menu!
